description.para: These methods return the contained value if it has the requested type.
Otherwise, a default-constructed value of the corresponding type is returned, or in case of the ...OrThrow variants, an Error (TypeMismatch) is thrown.
No type conversion or coercion is performed.

For example,
asInteger() returns the stored Integer if this value is of type Integer, or Integer{} otherwise.
asText() returns the stored String only if this value is of type Text, not if it's e.g. an Integer.
To obtain a textual representation of any supported type (e.g. Integer â†’ "42"), use toTextRepresentation().

briefdescription.para: Access as integer.

simplesect.para: The value of the requested type, or if this value has a different type, a default value.

detaileddescription.para:
@important This call does not convert a single value into a list with one element. Use the getList() methods if you like to have this behavior.

Error



(TypeMismatch) if the value is of another type.

briefdescription.para: This is a convenience method, accessed this value as one of the supported types.

detaileddescription.para: It is implemented calling the various to<Type>() methods.

@important
There are overloads for all integers, converting the signed 64-bit integer into the desired type.
There are overloads for all float types, converting a double into a float if necessary.
If the value exceeds the range of the target type:
for asType() saturation logic is used - returning the max/min possible value for the chosen type.
for asTypeOrThrow() a TypeMismatch exception is thrown.
The overload for ValueList works exactly like asValueList() and therefore does not convert a single value into a list with one element. Use the getList() methods for this behavior.
T
The type to access this value as.
The value or a default value.

briefdescription.para: This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

sectiondef.header: Get as Uniform Value Lists and Matrices

listitem.para: Tries to get this value as uniform lists that consist of values of the same type.
If this is a single value that matches the type, a list with one element is returned.

simplesect.para: A list with values of this type, or an empty list on any problem.
A list with values of this type.

parameterdescription.para: In case of any type mismatch or syntax error in the name path.

simplesect.para: A matrix with values of this type, or an empty matrix on any problem.
A matrix with values of this type.

parameterdescription.para: In case of any type mismatch or syntax error in the name path.

sectiondef.header: Get a Value of a Given Type

description.para: Tries to get a value at the given name-path with a given type.

listitem.para: If the name path is not valid,
or if there is no value at the name-path
or the value does not have the expected type,
a default value passed as defaultValue parameter is returned.
... or, an exception is thrown for the ...OrThrow methods. If types are converted, the same logic as described in asType() or asTypeOrThrow() applies.

memberdef.argsstring: (const NamePathLike &namePath, impl::value_get_default_param_t< tExpectedType > defaultValue={}) const noexcept

If no value is found at the given location, or the name-path contains syntax errors, an Error exception is thrown.

briefdescription.para: Get an iterator to the first child value.

simplesect.para: The value iterator.

briefdescription.para: Get an iterator to the end of the child values.

simplesect.para: The value iterator.

briefdescription.para: Convert this value to a value list.

detaileddescription.para: In contrast with asValueList, this method will not only return a value list if this is a value list, but also if this is a scalar value (Text, Integer, Float, Boolean, Date, Time, Date-Time, Bytes, TimeDelta, RegEx). If this is a scalar value, a value list with a single element is returned (this element).

briefdescription.para: This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.
Convert this value to a value matrix.

detaileddescription.para: This will return a matrix when this is a ValueList, a nested ValueList or a scalar value. For a nested value list, a matrix with the largest row and column count is returned. For a regular value list, a matrix with one column and the number of rows is returned. For a scalar value, a matrix with one row and one column is returned.

briefdescription.para: This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.
Convert this value to its text representation.

detaileddescription.para:
Converts the types: Text, Integer, Float, Boolean, Date, Time, Date-Time, Bytes, TimeDelta, RegEx. Sections and lists result in an empty string.
A string with the text or text representation.

briefdescription.para: Convert this value to its test adapter representation.

detaileddescription.para:
This is used by the test adapter to verify the value, as described in the language documentation. The general format is <Type>(<value>), where <Type> is one of the standardized type names and <value> the value representation as specified. For example, integer value 5 is converted into the text Integer(5). No additional info is added to sections.
format
The format of the output.
The value in its test outcome representation.

briefdescription.para: Convert this value into a visual value tree.

detaileddescription.para:
This method is useful for testing to get a visual representation of a parsed document, or a branch of the document.
format
The format of the output.
A text with a visual tree representation of this value.

briefdescription.para: Test if this container is empty.

simplesect.para: true if the container is empty.

briefdescription.para: Get the first value of a container.

simplesect.para: The first value or a nullptr.

briefdescription.para: Get the last value of a container.

simplesect.para: The last value or a nullptr.

briefdescription.para: The base class and interface for all values.
